results.title: Aggression - assertion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Moral Decision Making”.
By showing causes and expressions of aggression and self-assertion in a family and neighbourhood situation, this film aims to motivate classroom discussion. When assailed by the hostility of his brother and unable to retaliate, Joe goes off with his friends. In the course of their walk Joe see a radio on top of a garbage tin and becomes embroiled with Ed who also wants possession of the radio. Various responses which people might make in this situation are depicted.

group_siblings.title: Cheating
group_siblings.creator_credit: Graham Parker, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Oxford Films (U.S.)

results.title: Cheating
results.creator_credit: Graham Parker, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Moral Decision Making”.
Part of the “Moral decision making” series, this film is designed to stimulate a classroom discussion on cheating. A situation is dramatised showing a student, whose performance has dropped in maths, being offered a chance to see a test before it is given to him by the teacher. With the development of this situation, questions are posed and various possible responses for the student to his opportunity are depicted. Projector stops allow for class discussion as problems arise in the film. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

group_works.title: Peter O'toole on Lawrence of Arabia

results.title: Peter O'toole on Lawrence of Arabia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Monitor”.
On location in Spain Peter O’Toole, the star of Lawrence of Arabia, talks to Kenneth Griffiths about his approach to the role of Lawrence. Actual scenes of the shooting of the film around Almeria in Spain are shown.

results.title: Monday Conference
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Children, Television and Violence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Monday Conference”.
Dr. William Belsen, who has carried out extensive research on children, television and violence, talks with a Monday Conference audience comprising researchers, industry people, teachers and parents. Many interesting areas are touched upon including the difficulty of establishing casual links between television violence and real violence carried out by children, how parents can identify which programs are likely to be “casually” violent, and the possible cathartic effect of television violence

results.title: Dr. Elizabeth Kubler Ross
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Monday Conference”.
Dr Elizabeth Kubler-Ross explains her treatment of the problems surrounding death and dying. She also details ways of dealing with the particular problems involved in coming to terms with the death of a young child

results.title: Australian Aborigines: everything from nature
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Our reliance on manufactured goods is contrasted with the Aborigines’ ability to use the natural materials around them, which gives rise to a marked respect for their adaptability and sensitivity to the land. Taken during the University of Sydney’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land.

results.title: Australian aborigines: police tracker (A)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Explains how Jackie the full blooded aboriginal police tracker from Katherine learnt this skill, which enables the aboriginal to hunt and the police to keep law and order and to save lives in Australia’s outback. Taken during the University of Sydney’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land and produced in collaboration with Professor A.P. Elkin, Professor of Anthropology, University of Sydney.
